paper_title.en: Full O(alpha) electroweak radiative corrections to e(+)e(-) -> e(+)e(-) gamma at the ILC with GRACE-Loop

description.en: By using the GRACE-Loop system, we calculate the full O(alpha) electroweak radiative corrections to the process e(+)e(-) -> e(+)e(-) gamma, which is important for future investigations at the International Linear Collider (ILC). With the GRACE-Loop system, the calculations are checked numerically by three consistency tests: ultraviolet finiteness, infrared finiteness, and gauge-parameter independence. The results show good numerical stability when quadruple precision is used. In the phenomenological results, we find that the electroweak corrections to the total cross section range from similar to-4% to similar to-21% when.7s varies from 250 GeV to 1 TeV. The corrections also significantly affect the differential cross sections, which are a function of energies and angles of the final state particles. Such corrections will play an important role in the high-precision program at the ILC. (C) 2014 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.

paper_title.en: Full O(alpha) electroweak radiative corrections to e(+)e(-) -> t(t)over-bar gamma with GRACE-Loop

description.en: We present the full O(alpha) electroweak radiative corrections to the process e(+) e(-) -> t (t) over bar gamma at the International Linear Collider (ILC). The computation is performed with the help of the GRACE-Loop system. We present the total cross-section and the top quark forward-backward asymmetry (AFB) as a function of the center-of-mass energy and compare them with the process e(+) e(-) -> t (t) over bar. We find that the value of AFB in t (t) over bar gamma production is larger than AFB in t (t) over bar production. It is an important result for the measurement of the top quark forward-backward asymmetry at the ILC. Applying a structure function method, we also subtract the QED correction to gain the genuine weak correction in both the a scheme and the G(mu) scheme (delta(G mu)(W)). We obtain numerical values for delta(G mu)(W) which are changing from 2 % to -24 % when we vary the center-of-mass energy from 360 GeV to 1 TeV.

paper_title.en: Full O(alpha) electroweak radiative corrections to e(+)e(-) -> t(t)over-bar gamma with GRACE-Loop

description.en: We present the full O(alpha) electroweak radiative corrections to the process e(+) e(-) -> t (t) over bar gamma at the International Linear Collider (ILC). The computation is performed with the help of the GRACE-Loop system. We present the total cross-section and the top quark forward-backward asymmetry (AFB) as a function of the center-of-mass energy and compare them with the process e(+) e(-) -> t (t) over bar. We find that the value of AFB in t (t) over bar gamma production is larger than AFB in t (t) over bar production. It is an important result for the measurement of the top quark forward-backward asymmetry at the ILC. Applying a structure function method, we also subtract the QED correction to gain the genuine weak correction in both the a scheme and the G(mu) scheme (delta(G mu)(W)). We obtain numerical values for delta(G mu)(W) which are changing from 2 % to -24 % when we vary the center-of-mass energy from 360 GeV to 1 TeV.

paper_title.en: Numerical computation of two-loop box diagrams with masses

description.en: A new approach is presented to evaluate multi-loop integrals, which appear in the calculation of cross-sections in high-energy physics. It relies on a fully numerical method and is applicable to a wide class of integrals with various mass configurations. As an example, the computation of two-loop planar and nonplanar box diagrams is shown. The results are confirmed by comparisons with other techniques, including the reduction method, and by a consistency check using the dispersion relation. (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: 素粒子反応計算の自動化－－GRACEシステムの現状－－
paper_title.en: Automatic Calculation of Particle Scattering Cross Sections : Status of GRACE System

description.ja: 高エネルギー実験の将来計画であるLHC/ILC実験における最重要課題は,素粒子の標準模型における最後のミッシング・ピースであるヒッグス粒子と,標準模型を超える理論の最有力候補である超対称性理論の予言する粒子の探索/精密測定である.LHC/ILC実験のデータ解析に際してその信号およびバックグラウンド反応の精密な理論計算を行う必要があるが,これらの計算は手計算で行える範囲を大きく超えており,自動計算システムが必要不可欠である.素粒子反応の散乱断面積の自動計算ユーティリティであるGRACEシステムの現状について報告する.
description.en: The most important subject in future high energy experiments, LHC/ILC, is to search for/investigate the Higgs particle which is the last missing piece of the standard model. Another important subject is an investigation of physics beyond the standard model such as supersymmetric model. In future high energy experiments, experimental data analysis requires high precision theoretical prediction. To match for the required precision, theoretical calculation cannot be performed by hand. An automatic scattering amplitude generator such as the GRACE system is necessary. A status of the GRACE system is reported in this article.

publisher.ja: 一般社団法人日本物理学会

paper_title.en: GR@PPA 2.7 event generator for pp/p(p)over-bar collisions

description.en: The GR@PPA event generator has been updated to version 2.7. This distribution provides event generators for V (W or Z) +jets (<= 4 jets), V V +jets (<= 2 jets) and QCD multi-jet (<= 4 jets) production processes at pp, and p (p) over bar collisions, in addition to the four bottom quark productions implemented in our previous work (GR@PPA_4b). Also included are the top-pair and top-pair +jet production processes, where the correlation between the decay products are fully reproduced at the tree level. Namely, processes up to seven-body productions can be simulated, based on ordinary Feynman diagram calculations at the tree level. In this version, the GR@PPA framework and the process dependent matrix-element routines are separately provided. This makes it easier to add further new processes, and allows users to make a choice of processes to implement. This version also has several new features to handle complicated multi-body production processes. A systematic way to combine many subprocesses to a single base-subprocess has been introduced, and a new method has been adopted to calculate the color factors of complicated QCD processes. They speed up the calculation significantly.

paper_title.en: GR@PPA 2.7 event generator for pp/p(p)over-bar collisions

description.en: The GR@PPA event generator has been updated to version 2.7. This distribution provides event generators for V (W or Z) +jets (<= 4 jets), V V +jets (<= 2 jets) and QCD multi-jet (<= 4 jets) production processes at pp, and p (p) over bar collisions, in addition to the four bottom quark productions implemented in our previous work (GR@PPA_4b). Also included are the top-pair and top-pair +jet production processes, where the correlation between the decay products are fully reproduced at the tree level. Namely, processes up to seven-body productions can be simulated, based on ordinary Feynman diagram calculations at the tree level. In this version, the GR@PPA framework and the process dependent matrix-element routines are separately provided. This makes it easier to add further new processes, and allows users to make a choice of processes to implement. This version also has several new features to handle complicated multi-body production processes. A systematic way to combine many subprocesses to a single base-subprocess has been introduced, and a new method has been adopted to calculate the color factors of complicated QCD processes. They speed up the calculation significantly.

paper_title.en: NLO-QCD calculation in GRACE

description.en:
A current development-status of an automatic calculation system for a Feynman amplitude, GRACE, is reported especially for NLO-QCD processes.
For the tree-level calculation, the event generators for the QCD processes up to 7 final-state particles have been developed. For electro-weak processes, electron-positron scattering at an one-loop correction up to 4-body final state are already obtained using a GRACE system.
New developments of the GRACE system for the NLO-QCD processes are under construction. With the dimensional regularization, simple formulas of a loop integral for zero-, one- and two-off-shell external particle is obtained so far.
